704750f-b.text:
(1)
155-157 Hawilten Ave., east side, between Rapelye and Hicks Streets.
A view of Station T, ef the U.S. Post Office.
June 6, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing more of view No. 1.
August 5, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
704750f-b.folder: Hamilton Avenue & Rapelye Street, Brooklyn, NY

(1)
155-157 Hawilten Ave., east side, between Rapelye and Hicks Streets.
A view of Station T, ef the U.S. Post Office.
June 6, 1931.

704750f-a.folder: Hamilton Avenue & Rapelye Street, Brooklyn, NY

704749f-b.text:
Hamilton Avenue, east side, frori Columbia Street (right) to Woodhull Street, showing two brick buildings that were later demolished. Cn its site was erected a Socony gasoline station. The two houses form a triangle made up of the three above-mentioned thoroughfares. Columbia Street can be seen running in a northeasterly direction on the right; o the extreme left is a house on
Woodhull Street.
March 27, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The same site, showing the Socony gas station which replaced the old buildings. On the right are houses on Columbia Street; across the left corner of the gas station are those on
Woodhull Street.
704749f-b.folder: Hamilton Avenue & Columbia Street, Brooklyn, NY
